messages.title: The Housing Crisis Is At Tipping Point
messages.content: After seven years in power, the Conservative’s record on housing in this country is shameful. Over the past seven years, almost 200,000 fewer homeowners under 45. Labour will take radical steps to tackle the housing crisis by ensuring at least 60% of new homes built are affordable for young people and families on ordinary incomes.

messages.title: Re-elect Chuka Umunna, local boy - working hard for you
messages.content: Labour Scraps Uni Fees - Labour believes education should be free for everyone and will scrap £9,000 uni fees.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will take radical steps to tackle the housing crisis by ensuring at least 60% of new homes built are affordable for young people and families on ordinary incomes.

Labour will protect the NHS, as shown by its policies: introduce a National Care Service, scrap the NHS pay cap and put pay decisions back into the hands of the independent pay review body, guaranteed access to treatment within 18 weeks, and a new £250 million Children's Health Fund.
Labour will offer free childcare for 2-4 year olds.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour is the only party that can keep Streatham Labour. Vote tactically for Chuka Umunna.

issues.brexitEurope: Chuka is fighting a Tory hard Brexit. Theresa May and the Tories are intent on a job-destroying hard Brexit.
issues.economy: Labour believes education should be free for everyone and will scrap £9,000 uni fees.
issues.education: Labour believes education should be free for everyone and will scrap £9,000 uni fees.
issues.health: Labour policies: introduce a National Care Service, scrap the NHS pay cap and put pay decisions back into the hands of the independent pay review body, guaranteed access to treatment within 18 weeks, and a new £250 million Children's Health Fund.
issues.transport: Labour will stop the A&E crisis in its tracks. Strip Southern Rail of its franchise now.
issues.socialWelfare: Guaranteed access to treatment within 18 weeks; a new £250 million Children's Health Fund.
